questions.text: what caused the town of Martinville to no longer have a library?
Evan and Rafe have matching phones (that are not cell phones). What do they call these phones?
what is the name of the cat that lives at the Martinville History House?
who are the three people readers discover are actually ghosts?
questions.answer: Al, Ms. Scoggin and Mr. Brock

questions.text: what does Al build outside the Martinville History House with the help of Ms. Scoggin as the lookout?
what do Evan and Rafe discover happened to people in the fire that burned down the library?
what type of photograph did Evan find in one of the books from the little free library?
what famous mystery writer's name do Rafe and Evan discover on a library check out card from a library book in the little free library?
when Rafe and Evan visit Grantville Middle School, what do they say they will not have in middle school that they did have in elementary school?
where is the spot that Mr. O'Neal explains the fire at the library got started?
who does Mortimer try to help and does he also ask ("because they seem to know things") why frogs sing at night?
questions.answer: He is trying to help and asks the mice

questions.text: readers discover that Al grew up where?
what book is Evan reading and using to help solve the mystery of the library fire?
questions.answer: How to Write a Mystery Novel

questions.text: Al becomes friends with a library patron she calls "dear boy" and they decide to embark on a rescue together. What do they title their rescue?
what is the name of the mouse that Al and the dear boy rescue?
when Evan goes to explore the land where the library used to be, what does he find, with the help of Mortimer the cat?
what is located in what Evan and his neighbors called "their woods" that is considered dangerous and often involved dares to try to climb up to it?
what is something that Evan is afraid about and not too excited about concerning school?
questions.answer: Going to Grantville Middle School next year

questions.text: what does the key, which Evan found at the site of the old library, end up unlocking?
questions.answer: The padlock on the treehouse door

questions.text: what is one thing Rafe asks for that others maybe don't, that is another reason Evan thinks Rafe is fearless?
Evan and Rafe decide who else is a suspect for the fire BESIDES Evan's dad?
who does Evan discover is the real H.G. Higgins?
Mortimer hears about a cat called "the six-toed monster" and thinks it could possibly be who?
readers discover what actually started the fire to the library. What was it?
questions.answer: A mouse running with a matchstick in its mouth

questions.text: who becomes the librarian and the intern at the new library that Evan's dad had built in Martinville?
does a boy discover that his dad is actually the famous author, H.G. Higgins?
does a cat orchestrate a performance with mice to show humans how a fire started in the basement of a library?

does a 5th grade boy and his friend try to solve the mystery of why the library books in the little free library have the same return date as the fire that took place that burned down the town library?
do two ghosts and Al occupy a place called The Martinville History House?
does an orange polydactyl cat search for his long-lost sibling, Petunia?
does a ghost, a former assistant librarian and a cat work together to build a little free library?
is there a character that as a boy wanted to save mice from death who grows into a man who also prefers to save mice by driving them out of town rather than extinguishing them?
are there two ghosts, Ms. Scoggins and Mr. Brock, who were formerly people who never got to go on their first date to the movies?
is there a character who wants to give his teachers in middle school tomatoes on the first day instead of apples because he became a proficient gardener over the summer?
